summaries: UNREPORTED OPINION. granting Motion for Leave to Proceed in forma pauperis. Complaint is hereby dismissed with prejudice. The Clerk is directed to enter judgment. Signed by Judge Elaine D. Kaplan.

UNREPORTED OPINION: This court lacks jurisdiction over any claims raised by plaintiff's complaint. Accordingly, the complaint must be dismissed for lack of jurisdiction. The Clerk is directed to enter judgment. Motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis is granted. Signed by Senior Judge Eric G. Bruggink.
UNREPORTED OPINION and ORDER. The Clerk is directed to enter judgment. Signed by Judge Francis M. Allegra.

case_names: Ground Improvement Techniques, Inc. v. United States
summaries: UNREPORTED OPINION on MOTION to Substitute Party MOTION to Substitute Attorney Robert G. Barbour in place of Steven Schooley filed by GROUND IMPROVEMENT TECHNIQUES, INC., [48] denying Plaintiffs Ground Improvement Techniques, Inc. and MK-Ferguson Company Cross-Motion to Ratify Plaintiffs, filed June 7, 2013. Added attorney Robert Galen Barbour for GROUND IMPROVEMENT TECHNIQUES, INC.,,Robert Galen Barbour for MK FERGUSON COMPANY,,Robert Galen Barbour for SECURED PARTIES. Attorney Steven Roger Schooley terminated. The Clerks Office is directed to CORRECT the docket to reflect the substitution of the real parties in interest as plaintiffs, pursuant to RCFC 17(a)(3), as shown in the caption of this opinion; The Clerks Office is directed to SUBSTITUTE Mr. Robert G. Barbour, pursuant to RCFC 83.1(c)(4)(A)(i)(II), as the attorney of record for all plaintiffs in this case; and,Proceedings in this case, pursuant to the courts order of July 12, 2013, remain STAYED pending the resolution of the appeal before the Federal Circuit, and all provisions of that order remain in effect. Signed by Judge Lynn J. Bush.

case_names: Nevada Controls, LLC v. United States
summaries: UNREPORTED ORDER denying Motion to Dismiss - Rule 12(b)(1) and (6). (Plaintiff's Amended Complaint due by 6/27/2014). Signed by Judge Elaine D. Kaplan.

UNREPORTED Order. Case is dismissed for failure to state a claim upon which relief can be granted pursuant to Rule 12(b)(6). No costs. The Clerk is directed to enter judgment. Signed by Judge Charles F. Lettow.

UNREPORTED Memorandum Opinion and Order denying Motion to Appoint Counsel ; granting [16] Motion to Dismiss - Rule 12(b)(1). The Clerk is directed to enter judgment. Signed by Judge Susan G. Braden. Copy to parties.

UNREPORTED Memorandum Opinion and Final Order granting Motion to Dismiss - Rule 12(b)(1) and (6); and denying as moot [6] Motion to Strike, [8] Motion for Summary Judgment, and [10] Motion for Default. The Clerk is directed to enter judgment. In addition, plaintiff has thirty (30) days, pursuant to Rule 11(c)(3) of the Rules of the United States Court of Federal Claims, to show cause why the court should not issue an anti-filing injunction. If plaintiff does not do so, the Clerk will be further directed to accept no other actions or filings by Antonio Colbert, without an Order of the Chief Judge of the United States Court of Federal Claims. In the interim, the clerk's office shall reject any additional complaints from plaintiff unless accompanied by the court's required filing fee. Signed by Judge Susan G. Braden. (dls) Copy to parties. (USPS Tracking No. 9114 9010 7574 2690 0646 32)

UNREPORTED OPINION AND ORDER. The court GRANTS plaintiff's application to proceed in forma pauperis and DISMISSES plaintiff's complaint for lack of jurisdicition. Moreover, because the court lacks jurisdiction to hear plaintiff's claiUNREPORTED OPINION AND ORDER. The court GRANTS plaintiff's application to proceed in forma pauperis and DISMISSES plaintiff's complaint for lack of jurisdicition. Moreover, because the court lacks jurisdiction to hear plaintiff's claims, her ex parte motion for declaratory and injunctive relief is DENIED AS MOOT. The clerk is directed to enter judgment accordingly. The Clerk is directed to enter judgment. Signed by Judge Margaret M. Sweeney. (ac7) Copy to parties.ms, her ex parte motion for declaratory and injunctive relief is DENIED AS MOOT. The clerk is directed to enter judgment accordingly. The Clerk is directed to enter judgment. Signed by Judge Margaret M. Sweeney. (ac7) Copy to parties.
UNREPORTED OPINION dismissing plaintiffs' complaint for lack of jurisdiction.. The Clerk is directed to enter judgment. Signed by Judge Francis M. Allegra.

UNREPORTED ORDER: Because the ASBCA has rendered its decision, the stay in this case is now lifted. Plaintiff is directed to file a motion to amend the complaint in this case such that it reads "Wayne Singleton, d/b/a Singleton Enterprises v. United States" no later than Friday, April 25, 2014. Then, the parties shall file no later than Friday, May 2, 2014 a joint status report suggesting further proceedings in this matter.Amended due by 4/25/2014. Status Report due by 5/2/2014. Signed by Judge Margaret M. Sweeney. (ac7) Copy to parties.
